business.headline: Oracle cuts over 100 jobs in India as AI reshapes workforceOracle, which employs around 30,000 people in India, reported a revenue of Rs 20,459 crore in the year ended March 2024, a 20% jump from the previous year.

Backpacking on a budget: Smart forex tips for young travellersFor young backpackers, every rupee counts. While cheap flights and hostels often top the checklist, the way you manage foreign exchange could quietly decide whether your trip stays on budget, or slips into overspending.

Hyderabad on track to become a global tech hub: D Sridhar BabuHyderabad is aiming to become a global technology hub, focusing on innovation, start-ups, and talent development. At the India Today Conclave South 2025, D Sridhar Babu, Minister for IT, E&C, Industries & Commerce, outlined the city's vision.
Sensex ends 314 points higher, Nifty above 24,850; Infosys gains 5%The S&P BSE Sensex was up 314.02 points to close at 81,101.32, while the NSE Nifty50 added 95.45 points to end at 24,868.60.

Karisma Kapoor's children vs stepmother Priya in lawsuit over Sunjay Kapur's willSunjay Kapur's children, identified as the legal heirs, have filed a suit in Delhi High Court seeking partition of the estate, rendition of accounts, and a permanent injunction

Hyderabad aims to become a global technology hub, says D Sridhar BabuHyderabad, according to  D Sridhar Babu, is positioning itself as a global technology and innovation hub, with a strong focus on AI, start-ups, industry, and skill development, while aiming to balance economic growth with social welfare.

Ericsson lays off 100 Canadian employees amid global restructuringEricsson has confirmed that about 100 of its Canadian staff will lose their jobs as the company continues to restructure its workforce worldwide.
How can ease of business be improved in India's real estate sector?

The PF problem: Why so many employees struggle to access their own moneyEvery month, employees across India save a part of their salary in the Provident Fund. But system errors, bureaucratic delays, and glitches mean that for millions, claiming their own PF money has become a frustrating challenge.

How can India achieve affordable housing? Tata Realty CEO explainsSanjay Dutt, Managing Director and CEO of Tata Realty & Infrastructure Ltd, spoke about how India can work towards making affordable housing more accessible and practical.

From Agarwals to Patels: Which surnames rule India's richest family businesses?Behind India's richest family businesses lies an interesting pattern, certain surnames appear again and again. The Hurun India Rich List 2025 reveals which surnames dominate this legacy of wealth, with Agarwals, Guptas and Jains leading the pack.

Selling property? Here are 9 smart ways to save on capital gains taxSelling property can bring you a good profit, but it often comes with the worry of paying a hefty capital gains tax. Luckily, the Income Tax Act offers several ways to cut down or even avoid this tax if you plan wisely.

entertainment.headline: Steven Spielberg praises Leonardo Dicaprio's One Battle After Another: Insane filmDirector Paul Thomas Anderson's 'One Battle After Another' received high praise in its first reviews. Director Steven Spielberg and other critics praised the unique blend of absurdist comedy and intense storytelling.

Inside Bigg Boss Telugu Season 9: 9 celebs, 6 commoners, owners vs tenants format'Bigg Boss Telugu 9' premiered on September 7, 2025, bringing together nine celebrities and six commoners under the new 'Owners vs Tenants' format. The season divides the house into separate groups, setting the stage for clashes and drama as the contestants navigate the competition.

Kalyani Priyadarshan on Lokah's success: Proud to be India's 1st female superheroWith 'Lokah Chapter 1: Chandra' drawing acclaim, Kalyani Priyadarshan is being hailed for breaking new ground as India's first female superhero. In an exclusive conversation, the actor shared how she feels about her new title.

Prajakta Koli cancels Nepal travel plan amid protests, expresses solidarityActor-Youtuber Prajakta Koli cancelled her Nepal travel plans amid Gen-Z protests, expressing concern for those affected by the unrest and a social media ban.

Saba Azad, Imaad Shah on their bond after breakup: We became less judgmentalActors Saba Azad and Imaad Shah recently opened up on their breakup and the evolution of their relationship. They stated that their bond has transformed into a strong, family-like friendship with mutual support and understanding.

Actor Saiyami Kher feels films shape beliefs, inspire social change'Special Ops 2' actor Saiyami Kher, in an interview with IndiaToday.in, spoke about playing a spy and performing combat sequences. She also reflected on portraying strong characters on-screen, inspirational Hindi films and the role of sports in her life.

Actor Saloni Gaur feels excessive censorship limits satire and artActor-comedian Saloni Gaur, in an exclusive interview with IndiaToday.in, expressed her views on censorship, mental health, digital detox and more. She was recently seen in the slice-of-life series 'Lafangey'.

Ghatiya aurat, fake shakal: Aahana and Bali's explosive fight rock Rise & FallActor Aahana Kumra and influencer Bali engaged in a verbal clash during the nomination task on 'Rise & Fall.' Both contestants exchanged personal insults and called each other fake.

Catherine Zeta-Jones watches SRK's Om Shanti Om at US Open, fans praise her tasteActor Catherine Zeta-Jones shared her fondness for Shah Rukh Khan's 'Om Shanti Om'. The actor enjoyed watching the iconic Bollywood film while waitig for US Open.

Shwetha Menon pushes for better work conditions for women, reflects on fixed hoursActor Shwetha Menon, the first woman president of AMMA, stressed the need for fixed working hours for women in cinema at India Today South Conclave 2025. Drawing from her own pregnancy shoots, she highlighted how communication, support systems, and fear of career setbacks continue to shape women's struggles in the film industry.

Shwetha Menon on obscenity case: Was shattered, then I became a fiery tigressAt the India Today Conclave South 2025, actor Shwetha Menon reacted to the FIR filed against her while she was contesting for the president of Association of Malayalam Movie Artistes (AMMA).

Actor Shwetha Menon discusses being 1st woman leader of AMMA, safe working spacesActor Shwetha Menon took charge as the first female president of the Association of Malayalam Movie Artists (AMMA), highlighting key changes in the organisation post-Covid. She addressed challenges including legal cases and stressed communication and content over gender biases.

Cooking doesn't define a woman - lesson 101 from Kunickaa-Tanya's BB 19 clashThe Kunickaa Sadanand vs Tanya Mittal clash in 'Bigg Boss 19' isn't just another kitchen fight, it shines a harsh light on how women empowerment is still misunderstood. Cooking doesn't define a woman, and the explosive debate proves why empowerment is about freedom of choice, not outdated gender roles.

Dhanashree: Getting movie offers for my talent, not because of what happenedChoreographer Dhanashree Verma opened up about getting multiple offers for films in the recent episode of 'Rise & Fall.' She said she is being offered films because of her talent and not what happened in her personal life. Dhanashree and cricketer Yuzvendra Chahal got divorced in March 2025.

Punjab floods: Salman's Being Human foundation sends boats, to adopt villagesActor Salman Khan's Being Human foundation has joined the rescue and relief work as Punjab faces floods. The foundation has sent five boats to flood-affected areas. It has also planned to adopt flood-hit border villages near Husainiwala.

Is Rise & Fall what Bigg Boss once used to be?'Rise & Fall' debuts as a fresh reality show focusing on power and social divides. Here's a look at how this show will remind you what 'Bigg Boss' used to be.

Gandhi premiere at Tiff 2025: Hansal Mehta's series wins standing ovationFilmmaker Hansal Mehta's series 'Gandhi' had its grand premiere at the 50th Toronto International Film Festival. The series even received a standing ovation at the festival.

KBC 17: IAS aspirant fails to answer Rs 7.5 lakh question. Can you?Kaun Banega Crorepati 17: In the episode aired on September 8, the first contestant, Abhishek, took the hot seat. However, his journey came to an end at the Rs 7.5 lakh question, one that even the audience failed to answer correctly. Can you answer this?

Vashu Bhagnani claims Ali Abbas Zafar inflated Bade Miyan budget by Rs 80 croreProducer Vashu Bhagnani recently levied serious allegations against director Ali Abbas Zafar. Bhagnani accused the filmmaker of money laundering.

general news.headline: Nepal's stability vital to India: PM urges peace as Kathmandu sees violent protestsPM Modi called the violence in Nepal "heart-rending", adding that the stability, peace and prosperity of the Himalayan nation are of "utmost importance" to India.

Apple Event 2025 Live Updates: iPhone 17, iPhone 17 Pro, 17 Pro Max expectedApple iPhone 17 Series Launch Event 2025 Live Updates: Three of the incoming iPhones are likely to be on expected lines. These are the iPhone 17, iPhone 17 Pro, and iPhone 17 Pro Max. Joining them will be a new iPhone, the long-rumoured and highly anticipated, iPhone 17 Air. Here are the details.

CP Radhakrishnan is Vice-President, Sudershan Reddy's tally shows cracks in Opposition  Live UpdatesNDA candidate CP Radhakrishnan is the 15th Vice President of India, defeating his rival INDIA bloc candidate B Sudershan Reddy (300) by 452 to 300 votes.

Israel says it attacked Hamas leadership in Doha, 5 killedIsrael stated it would continue to act to "defeat the Hamas terrorist organisation." The attack comes days after Israeli army chief Eyal Zamir threatened to target Hamas leaders abroad and hours after Israel's Foreign Minister Gideon Saar said the country had accepted a Gaza ceasefire proposal.

Oli, India and the curious timing of Nepal protestsThe massive protests in Nepal in which 20 people have been killed came ahead of PM KP Sharma Oli's planned trip to India and after his return from China. India's immediate neighbourhood has become a playground of diverse external forces. Though the Gen Z protests seem to be spontaneous, they come amid China-US tug-of-war and can be hijacked, warn experts.

Nepal PM KP Sharma Oli resigns amid deadly Gen Z protests, death toll climbs to 22Protests continued in Nepal for the second day despite the government announcing that it had lifted the ban on social media platforms. The second day of demonstrations left two more people dead, pushing the death toll to 22.

Live: Nepal Army Chief addresses nation amid violent protests, appeals for peaceKP Sharma Oli resigned as Nepal's Prime Minister on Tuesday following violent protests triggered by a ban on major social media platforms and anger over corruption. At least 22 people were killed and hundreds injured as police used deadly force against demonstrators, mostly youths leading what came to be called the "Gen Z" movement. Despite the government rolling back the ban, protests intensified on the second day, with crowds attacking and injuring Nepalese leaders. India Today is reporting live from ground zero in Nepal. Pankaj Das, Amit Bharadwaj and Rohit Singh are present at the scene. Follow indiatoday.in for live updates.

Former Nepal PM's wife dies of burns after protesters set their house on fireAccording to family members, a group of protesters allegedly forced her inside the residence before igniting the blaze. She was rushed to Kirtipur Burn Hospital in critical condition but could not survive her injuries.

How Nepal is following Bangladesh script, line for line | 5 pointsNepal Prime Minister KP Sharma Oli resigned on Tuesday after protests by youngsters over social media ban turned into an anti-regime agitation. Nepal's Gen Z protests have uncanny similarities to the Bangladesh agitation from July-August 2024 that toppled the regime of PM Sheikh Hasina. Here's a 5-point explainer.

Live: PM meets Veep-elect Radhakrishnan after NDA candidate defeats Sudershan ReddyVice President Election 2025 Voting Live Updates: Former Maharashtra Governor CP Radhakrishnan secured 452 first preference votes to win the vice-presidential election, defeating his challenger from INDIA bloc, Justice B Sudershan Reddy, who received 300 votes, Returning Officer PC Mody announced. Stay with IndiaToday.in for live updates

When GenZ gets out of their cyber-dwelling and on to the real streets...fireworks!What began as young people curating songs for Instagram Reels turned into a fight for their digital homes when Nepal's government banned social media. The blackout broke the trance, sparking protests that soon targeted corruption. With 19 dead and the Prime Minister gone, the unrest has laid bare how fragile regimes can be.

Who is Balen Shah, Gen Z protesters' favourite for Nepal PM?Balen Shah, Kathmandu's mayor and former rapper, has emerged as a trusted leader for Nepal's Gen Z, earning admiration for supporting the agitation against corruption and social media ban. Gen Zers, who forced out KP Sharma Oli from power, are batting for Shah to take over. Shah's 2022 victory symbolised a generational shift in Nepali politics.

Fungus on hands, smelly clothes, can't live in jail: Darshan asks judge for poisonActor Darshan, accused in the Renukaswamy murder case in Karnataka, pleaded with the judge to give him poison, citing unbearable jail conditions. The judge refused his request.

Karisma Kapoor's children vs stepmother Priya in lawsuit over Sunjay Kapur's willSunjay Kapur's children, identified as the legal heirs, have filed a suit in Delhi High Court seeking partition of the estate, rendition of accounts, and a permanent injunction

Pakistan blends Chinese firewall, Western tools to spy on millionsThe security state of Pakistan, led by Asim Munir, fusing Chinese censorship tech with Western surveillance tools has built one of the world's most extensive monitoring systems outside China, reveals an Amnesty report. From mass phone-tapping to internet blackouts, the Munir-led regime is weaponising technology to crush dissent, silence opposition, and tighten military control.

996 is latest work culture craze in Silicon Valley tech companies, 5-day week can go take a hikeIt seems work culture in Silicon Valley tech companies is changing, largely driven by startups and teams that hustle. Once famed for relaxed work in companies like Google and Microsoft, the town is now host to work craze called 996, which means working from 9am to 9pm and six days a week.

Noida woman's 'I choose to leave India' post sparks debate on reservation policiesA Noida-based woman shared that she is leaving India to pursue an MBA abroad after failing to secure admission to the institutes she considered the "best" in the country, blaming reservation policies for it. Her LinkedIn post has now sparked a debate on the issue. Read on:

How Nitish Kumar is wooing Bihar's woman voteNitish Kumar's Mukhya Mantri Mahila Rozgar Yojana is being pitched as another step towards women's self-reliance; yet the Bihar election subtext is unmistakable

'Queen of Code' Grace Hopper and the moth that gave us the word 'computer bug'Mathematician Grace Hopper, who earned a PhD at Yale and later became a US Navy rear admiral, pioneered compilers and helped shape modern programming. On September 9, 1947, she logged the first "computer bug" when a moth halted the Harvard Mark II.

Canada rejects 80% Indian student visas in 2025, top choice status fallsCanada, once a top destination for study-abroad aspirants, rejected 80% of visa applications for Indian students in 2025, the highest in a decade. Barely 9% of Indian study abroad aspirants now see it as the top choice. With growing uncertainty and mounting challenges, what does studying in Canada look like now, and what new study-abroad dreams are Indian students embracing?

Indian couple assaulted by Chinese man during Switzerland holiday, shares post, picsAn Indian-origin couple alleged that they were brutally assaulted by a Chinese hotel manager during their holiday in Switzerland.

With Nepal, India's neighbourhood in turmoil again. US vs China playing out?Nepal protests: What started as an agitation in Nepal against a social media ban, quickly spiralled into protests against corruption, forcing Prime Minister KP Sharma Oli to resign. It follows a familiar script that happened in Bangladesh and Sri Lanka.

sports.headline: Nikhat Zareen battles past Nishinaka to reach Worlds Boxing Championship QFNikhat Zareen fought through a scrappy contest to edge Japan's Yuna Nishinaka and reach the World Boxing Championships quarterfinals. The Indian star now faces Turkey's Buse Naz Cakiroglu in her bid for a third world medal.

Who is Abhimanyu Mishra: 16-year-old Grandmaster stuns D Gukesh in FIDE Grand SwissFIDE Grand Swiss 2025: At 16, Abhimanyu Mishra defeated reigning world champion Gukesh Dommaraju in a stunning 61-move match. The stunning victory came a day after the American Grandmaster held top seed R Praggnanandhaa with black pieces.

Rohit Sharma does not fit in all-time Indian greats list: Sanjay ManjrekarSanjay Manjrekar has excluded Rohit Sharma from the all-time Indian batting greats list, citing his Test record. Rohit retired from Tests earlier this year after scoring 4301 runs from 67 matches.

India vs UAE, Asia Cup 2025 All you need to know: Predicted XI, live streamingIndia begin their Asia Cup 2025 journey against hosts UAE in Dubai. With Suryakumar Yadav leading and Shubman Gill back as vice-captain, the defending champions aim to make a winning statement in their opening clash.

Asia Cup: Won't ask players to downplay aggression, say India and Pakistan captainsAsia Cup 2025: India and Pakistan captains, Suryakumar Yadav and Salman Ali Agha, were in the spotlight as the captains of all eight teams spoke to the press in Dubai on Tuesday, September 9.

SA20 auction: Coach Ganguly makes a mark with big buys for Pretoria CapitalsSourav Ganguly made a winning start as Pretoria Capitals head coach by securing top players in the SA20 auction. The record signing of Dewald Brevis highlights Pretoria's strong push to improve after last season's poor finish.

Want Babar Azam to play T20Is, says Wasim Akram despite Asia Cup snubWasim Akram has called for Babar Azam's return to Pakistan's T20I side. He feels his inclusion could strengthen tricky run chases, but also praised Salman Agha's leadership, saying that it brings a fearless approach to the young team.

Ange Postecoglou signs as Nottingham Forest manager 2 months after Tottenham sackAnge Postecoglou takes the reins at Nottingham Forest just two months after leaving Tottenham Hotspur. The Australian aims to bring high-energy attacking football to a side built for Nuno's defensive approach, starting with Arsenal.

Ahmedabad's Narendra Modi Stadium likely to host T20 World Cup 2026 finalThe T20 World Cup 2026 will be held in India and Sri Lanka next year. The final of the tournament is likely to be be played at the Narendra Modi Stadium, which also hosted the final of the 2023 men's ODI World Cup.

Dewald Brevis sold for record-breaking R 16.5 million as Super Kings lose starDewald Brevis became the most expensive player in SA20 history, being sold at R16.5 million. Pretoria Capitals secured the young star amid intense bidding from Joburg Super Kings.

He feels his inclusion could strengthen tricky run chases, but also praised Salman Agha's leadership, saying that it brings a fearless approach to the young team.

The Australian aims to bring high-energy attacking football to a side built for Nuno's defensive approach, starting with Arsenal.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
